title: Little Omelets
introduction: Miniature omelets, often prepared on a griddle similar to pancakes, are perfect additions to an antipasto spread or as a delicious sandwich filling. Originating from Piedmont, this variation incorporates leeks and cabbage for a unique and flavorful twist.
ingredients: 1 medium leek, trimmed and thinly sliced

instructions.instruction: In a 9-inch nonstick heavy skillet, heat 3 tablespoons oil over medium-low heat. Stir in the cabbage and leek. Cover the skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, until the cabbage is very tender, about 30 minutes. Let cool.
In a medium bowl, beat together the eggs, cheese, and salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the vegetable mixture.
Lightly brush a griddle or a large nonstick skillet with oil. Heat over medium heat.

Stir the egg mixture and scoop by 1/4 cupful onto the griddle, spacing the omelets about 4 inches apart. Flatten slightly with the back of a spoon. Cook until the eggs are set and the omelets begin to brown on the bottom, about 2 minutes. With a pancake turner, flip the omelets and cook on the other side for about 1 minute more. Transfer the omelets to a plate.
Cook the remaining omelets in the same way. Serve hot or at room temperature.
